results.title: Flying over mother
results.creator_credit: AFTRS, Melanie Coombs and Michael James Rowland
results.brief_description:
1. Vladimir is growing up on an isolated farm somewhere on the Russian Steppes. He has been brought up on his mother’s stories of all the dangers that lie in wait for boys who misbehave and he is trying - not very successfully - to overcome his fears. But one day something happens that will change the direction of his life.
  2. Vladimir has finally reached his goal - he has trained as a cosmonaut and is circling the earth. But unfortunately his capsule has malfunctioned and things don’t look so good for him…

results.title: Audacious
results.creator_credit: Fiona Tuomy, Samantha Lang and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
Stella, a young woman bored with her husband’s bedroom behaviour, embarks on a daring journey to the other side of sexual satisfaction.
Cast features Dee Smart as Stella and John Polson as Tom.

results.title: Redball
results.creator_credit: Jon Hewitt, Phillip Parslow, Meredith King, Scanbox Entertainment, Rough Beast, Paper Bark Films, Palace Films, King Hit, Gray Malkin Productions and Film Victoria
results.brief_description: Redball is rife with some extreme black humour, violence, several corrupt, rather nasty detectives, and one dedicated and honest detective, “JJ” Wilson. JJ (Belinda McClory), along with her partner Robbie Walsh (John Brumpton), have been assigned to investigate a serial child killer codenamed Mr Creep. JJ is particularly upset by the horrific nature of the murders and becomes totally obsessed in her desire to put Mr Creep away. Surrounded by corrupt colleagues and not knowing who to trust, JJ feels more and more alienated and emotionally on the edge. When evidence begins to point to Mr Creep being a member of the police force, it seems that nothing will stop JJ from tracking him down and seeking vengeance. Throughout the film there are subplots interwoven with the central story keeping it fast-paced, darkly humourous, brutally chilling. This low budget film was shot on digital video in the streets of Melbourne and backed with some great original music by Neil McGrath. Cast also includes Frank Magree, Peter Docker, Anthea Davis, Neil Pigot, Paulene Terry-Beitz, Daniel Wyllie.

results.title: Red rock west
results.creator_credit: John Dahl, Steve Golin, Sigurjon Sighvatsson and Red Rock Films
results.brief_description: Michael Williams (Nicholas Cage) is an ex-marine, down on his luck and desperate for work. When he stumbles into the dusty desert town of Red Rock, he is mistakenly identified by the local saloon owner (J.T. Walsh) as the hired gun commissioned to kill his unfaithful wife, Suzanne (Lara Flynn-Boyle). Taking the money but choosing instead to warn her, Michael is faced with another indecent proposal when Suzanne doubles the offer - to kill her husband! Again, Michael accepts the “job” and tries to leave town before his luck changes but on the road leaving Red Rock, he discovers it already has - the real killer has just arrived!

results.title: Reilly: ace of spies: an affair with a married woman
results.creator_credit: Jim Goddard, Chris Burt and Euston Films
results.brief_description: Sidney Reilly, said to have been the inspiration for James Bond, was probably the greatest spy the world has ever known. A rogue, womaniser, and brilliant tactician, he thrived on danger, performing extraordinary feats that changed the course of history. Reilly’s first mission involves undertaking a dangerous journey to Baku to investigate the Russian search for oil in the Middle East. Stars Sam Neill and Leo McKern.

results.title: Red river(Captioned)
results.brief_description: Director Howard Hawks’ classic western stars the legendary John Wayne at the peak of his career and Montgomery Clift in his screen debut. Walter Brennan heads the outstanding supporting cast. The film is an account of the first cattle drive over the Chisolm Trail, from deep Texas to Abilene, Kansas. Authentic detail and stunning cinematography bring to life the trials and tribulations of this extraordinary challenge for the men who battled the dust, rain, heat and frustration of the long, hard drive. The demands of this rigorous journey further strain the edgy relationship between the film’s key characters. Tom Dunson (John Wayne) is a self-made cattle king whose single-mindedness has turned him into a cold-blooded executioner, ruthlessly determined to take the cattle to Abilene his way. Arguably the best western ever produced, “Red River” captures both the grandeur of the early West and the sheer determination of its people.

results.title: Red Nightmare
results.creator_credit: George Waggner, William L. Hendricks, United States. Dept. of Defense and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: An anti communist drama sponsored by the U.S Government, supervised by Jack L. Warner and produced during the Cold War. The drama revolves around a small town American who takes his civil liberties for granted until he dreams of a communist takeover which jolts him out of his complacency. Narrated by Jack Webb. Photographed by Robert Hoffman. Written by Vincent Fotre. Music by William Lava. Edited by Folmer Blargsted. Starring Jack Kelly, Jeanne Cooper, Andrew Duggan, Peter Brown, Patricia Woodell, Peter Breck, Robert Conrad, Mike Road.

results.title: Red house
results.creator_credit: Delmer Daves, Col Lesser and JEF Films
results.brief_description: What is the macabre secret of the terrifying Red House? Hidden deep within the spooky Oxhead Woods, it guards hidden mysteries of the dark past - puzzlements of passions and torture that threaten to surface and shatter innocent lives. Highlighted by atmospheric photography and a clever script, superb acting from Edward G. Robinson, Lon McCallister and Judith Anderson, with eerie blood-chilling music, this film is a blockbuster of a suspense thriller you will not soon forget.

results.title: Red firecracker, green firecracker [DVD] = Pao da shuang deng
results.creator_credit: He Ping, Yung Naiming, Chan Chun-Keung and Yung and Associates
results.brief_description: Cai Chunzhi’s (Jing Ning) family own a prosperous firecracker factory on the banks of the Yellow River in Northern China. When her father dies, because she is the only child she inherits the factory and becomes “Master”. She dresses like a man and everyone addresses her as “Master” but as a woman, her hold on power is tenuous and she carefully respects the authority of the factory head, Man Dihong. When she hires an artist to paint door gods for the Chinese New Year her life is turned upside down. Niu Bao is a handsome young painter whose pride and headstrong nature put him on a collision course with Dihong, as Bao and his ‘master’ struggle with their attraction to each other. Winner of 3 Golden Rooster Awards (the Chinese equivalent of the Oscars). Based on the novel by Feng Jicai.

results.title: Red dust
results.creator_credit: Victor Fleming, Hunt Stromberg, Victor Fleming Productions and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Based on a play by Wilson Collison, “Red Dust” is a fiery romance drama set on a rubber plantation in Vietnam. Dennis Carson (Clark Gable) is happy in the ‘male’ world of the rubber plantation which he runs. Then one day Vantine (Jean Harlow), a brassy blonde floozy escaping from some ‘trouble’ in Saigon arrives at the plantation. The sparks fly as Vantine wears down Carson’s gruff exterior with her special charms. Then Gary Willis (Gene Raymond) a surveyor arrives with his earnest, refined wife Barbara (Mary Astor). Tensions rise as Carson dumps Vantine and begins pursuing Barbara. Directed by Victor Fleming, “Red Dust” perfectly teams the masculine and feminine sexual personas of Harlow and Gable. In 1953 the film was remade, again with Gable, as “Mogambo”.
